name: Steve Campion
bio: Storyteller 📺 Texas Transplant 🙋🏼‍♂️ Floridian 🐊 Beach Aficionado 🏝 Houstonian 🚀 Traveler 🌏 Emoji Enthusiast 😉

social_posts.post_text:
“Trust in the Heavens above,” said my Mama. 🙏 She didn’t just tell me that often. She put those words down in writing. As many of you know, my mother Annie unexpectedly passed away in December 2020. What you may not know is that more than a year later … my sister and I stumbled upon a handwritten letter. We were cleaning out a room in my childhood home. The letter was tucked away in a box and written almost 20 years ago. As you might suspect, it took us by complete surprise.

It was quintessential Annie. She wrote to her daughter and son … knowing one day we would need her words to carry us through grief, heartbreak, and loss. Our mother comforted us from beyond. I’m sharing Annie’s words with y’all today in case you need a reason to believe in something special, something greater than this world. Her optimism in a better tomorrow helps guide me everyday.

“Life is a precious, precious gift. Take care and know how much you are thought of and loved. Loved in a way that mere words are incapable of explaining. Feel this love. Know how very real it is and that it has an unbelievable power within our human soul,” she wrote.

My Mom Annie found great pride knowing so many of you connect with me on social media. Today would’ve been her 66th birthday here on Earth. It’s also International Women’s Day - something my Mom always reminded us of, always telling her granddaughter (my niece) … women can do anything they dream of, there is no glass ceiling unable to be shattered. Time is a funny thing, friends. As more of it passes, the love I have for my Mom only seems to get stronger. ♥️

Her closing words to her children?

“You two are so very special. You must always know this. Do not ever allow anyone or anything intimidate you ever, in your entire life!”

Words of advice … I know she’d shared with all of you if she was with us today. 🙌 

Happy Birthday, Mom! 🥳 You’re deeply loved & forever in this family’s heart.
Always representing #Houston … no matter where the road leads. 🙌
It’s so easy to fall in love with #Houston. 🚀 Visitors beware. 🚨 She’ll have you growing old with her in no time. 🧔🏼‍♂️ Kidding aside. Hope you’re having the most stellar summer ever. 🕺🏼

To the beautiful & brillant Pooja … Happy Birthday! 🥳 You’re an incomparable 💎, a Houston treasure and a 🔥 of a friend. 🙌 Wishing you the happiest of celebrations … you talented 👸🏼! Thanks for always being there through the cheers and tears. 🥹

Like a postcard. 📸 There’s no better way to describe #RhodeIsland in the summer.  Y’all ever been? 👀 I recently spent a weekend in the #OceanState - 🚴, 🚤, & 🍷. It was extra special because I got to see a former colleague from 📺 - a Rhode Islander who graciously showed this Astros fan all the best spots. Thanks for the memories, Allison! You’re a 💎.

#Ecuador is 🔥. I tell y’all this … the land of volcanoes, waterfalls and ancient history is simply stunning. I spent a week there this summer. The country is beautiful - full of such warm people, out of this world heights and rich in culture. 🇪🇨 I’m feeling really grateful for friendships that have lasted years and logged thousands of miles.

I’ll also admit I didn’t hate escaping these 💯 degrees days in Houston. 🥵

Sometimes Heaven has a way of saying hello. 😉 

#puertoescondido #oaxaca #sunset #pacific #ocean

UPDATE 🚨 The woman who pleaded guilty in #VanessaGuillen’s case will be sentenced in about a week. #CecilyAguilar pleaded guilty to murder after the fact and three counts of making false statements. I recently spoke with @mayraaaguillen who says she and her family will be back in court on Monday, August 14th in Waco. Aguilar faces decades in prison. I’ll keep you posted on what happens. I snapped this photo a few weeks back outside Laredo Taqueria on Washington Ave in #Houston. You don’t have to look far in this city to see Vanessa memorialized in murals, to see so much ❤️ for her. Sending love and strength to the Guillen family. -Steve

#justiceforvanessaguillen

30 YEARS IN PRISON 🚨 A federal judge just sentenced #CecilyAguilar to 30 years in prison. She pleaded guilty to accessory to murder after the fact and lying to investigators. In court today, body camera footage showed Cecily telling investigators how she and Aaron Robinson disposed of #VanessaGuillen’s body alongside the Leon River in central Texas. 30 years was the maximum amount the judge could give in the case. “I‘m so sorry for the things I did to Vanessa,” said Aguilar as she addressed the Guillen family. She said her actions haunt her.
I can’t believe I made it! 😂 It only took 9 years in #Houston … but I finally made it to #WhiteLinenNight in the #Heights. Y’all, is this city on 🔥 or what? She’s been hot lately.

The water will always be my happy place. Wait a minute … is summer really almost over? 🥺
.
.
.
.
.
.
#conroe #texas #lakeconroe #jetski
Grateful for the moments. 🙌 Happy for this life. 🕺🏼 Can’t wait to see what tomorrow may bring. 🚀

ARRESTED 🚨 This update is hard to believe, friends. To be honest, it's stunning. I vividly remember a Houston police officer (once assigned to the case) seemingly dismiss the seriousness of this man's disappearance ... even suggesting this man was dead as way to keep me from reporting about it. Court records show Erik Arcenaux is now in the Harris County Jail after years of being on the run as a wanted fugitive. Arcenaux is accused of murdering Maria Jimenez-Rodriguez in June 2018. Detectives said he used a chainsaw to dismember Maria's body. To this day, Maria's remains have never been recovered. This case is near and dear to my heart. For years, I spoke with Maria's sister Gloria. Gloria never gave up hope. She told me she prayed to the Virgin Mary to bring Arcenaux to justice. She prayed when she had nowhere else to turn. 🙏 She repeatedly told me she believed her sister's case deserved more attention. It did. It should've gotten more attention. It appears Gloria's prayers have finally been answered. Gloria's faith reminds me nothing is impossible. I'm sending her and Maria's entire family so much love tonight as they walk through this grief once again. ❤️ Maria left behind a young daughter named Destiny. May God watch over her. -Steve

Sometimes Heaven has a way of saying hello. 😉 

#Houston #rainbow #Texas
#Vegas with your best friend is always a good idea. 🔥 @ladygaga made the trip extra special. 👏 Back in #Houston, enjoying this stellar weather. Are we ready for an #Astros win? 🤞

Houston, you’d be so proud! 🕺🏼 My beautiful sister Anne Marie recently came for a visit. It felt like a whirlwind but I showed her … why so many people love this big city to the moon & back! 🚀 What’s your favorite spot around town? 👀 Also, can we keep this cooler weather forever? 🙏
Hopelessly in love with you, #Houston. 🚀 What a beautiful night at the @empresarioslatinostx gala. 🕺🏼Y’all having a stellar weekend? 👀

Can I tell you a secret? 🤫 Maybe it’s that spirit of #Thanksgiving … but lately I’ve been full of gratitude. Grateful to live in such a gorgeous world, blessed to visit stunning places like #BigBend. Grateful to be surrounded by such incredible friends including so many of you! I just wanted to swing by your feed and wish you all the joy, all the love and all the success in this life.

Wishing my niece Bryanna … the happiest of birthdays! 🥳 She’s grown into such a smart young woman, a talented softball player and will forever be one of my favorite people to go to the beach with. 🏝️ Happy 14th, Bryanna!

Tell me you LOVE West Texas … without telling me you love West Texas. 🤠 A couple things. First, find yourself a crazy friend who will act a clown with you … like wearing a @bucees onesie while ATVing in the desert. 🌵 Thanks for the memories, @poojaabc13. 🔥 Second, wishing y’all the happiest of holidays! 🎄 Tis’ the season to lean into life. 😉
Christmas at Mycah’s! 🎄 Thanks for the holiday cheer, friend. 🥂 Love you to the moon & back! 🚀
Merry Christmas, ya filthy animals!!! 🎄 From the bottom of my heart, wishing you all so much joy and happiness this holiday season. 🙌

Life feels like a rollercoaster. 🎢 You’re strapped into the ride … forced to endure whatever twists and turns come along the way. I’ll tell you what. I’m looking back at #2023 with a full heart, a deep sense of gratitude, and a hell of a lot of love for the people in my life … so many beautiful souls who’ve made this year one of the best. ♥️ Wishing y’all the happiest of new years. Happy #NewYear, friends! Love you to the moon & back. 🚀
Storyteller 📺 Texas Transplant 🙋🏼‍♂️ Floridian 🐊 Beach Aficionado 🏝 Houstonian 🚀 Traveler 🌏 Emoji Enthusiast 😉
